subject: Missing parts
description_text:
My order number is SSN3026.
THIS ORDER SHOULD HAVE CAME WITH A POWER CORD. IT IS MISSING. I WAITED 2 WEEKS FOR THESE TO ARRIVE AND I STILL CANT USE THEM. HOW CAN I GET A POWER CORD SENT TO ME ASAP? 
Sent from my iPhone

conversations.body_text: Hi Ryon Remmers,    You mean the package didn't include the complimentary US-standard power adapter plug?

the box did include a plug for the 120v home socket. But the list states it comes with a power supply. I chose this kit over others because of they. The voltage converter box up to the connection to the controller box (yellow tipped plug in the picture) did not come with the package. I’ve attached a pic just for reference. 
Sent from my iPhone

>
Hi Ryon Remmers,    We'll send you a replacement power supply. We apologize for the inconvenience caused!

Thank you! 
Sent from my iPhone

>
Hi Ryon Remmers,    Here is your logistics tracking link.  https://t.17track.net/en#nums=SF6047050123142

I’ve got my power supply thank you but now I’m having issues with connection. 
Haptic feedback lasts about 2 laps and then shuts off, I’ve also noticed that they slightly vibrate the entire time, even when not in a game. Is this something you can help me with? I have tried things I’ve found online, I’m ensure I’m using a direct 3.0 use at my computer. Software has been updated. If I disconnect USB and reconnect it works but stops after a few laps. I saw somewhere that I may need a ground wire but not sure where I would ground it to? Any advice would be great. 
Sent from my iPhone

>

I am getting way more than frustrated with these haptic motors i purchased. I purchased the VAM pro linear motor. Order #SSN3026. when they arrived i was missing the power cord. You sent that to me no problem. Them once set up the haptics did not function at all. I am left with a Simsonn flasher error. I had tried multiple things like updating the unit along with manually updating. I email Simsonn about this issue and i was told to ground the unit. I connected a ground wire to the control box and then to my computer housing as instructed. After this the pedals did work however they continued to shut off after 30-60 min of play. So, I moved to a slightly larger wire (the wire I originally used was tiny) i connect to the exact same spot and at the same time mounted the controller directly to the bottom of my rig so that it was ground out there also. Since i have moved the ground, I continue to get the Simsonn flasher error. I really want these to work; I don't want to be asking for a refund. What can i do to make these work. I have also found that every time they would turn off  I could get them to work by disconnecting the signal USB and reconnecting. This is no longer working. 
Sent from my iPhone

>

Hi Ryon Remmers,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
